climbs.name: Forgotten Roots
climbs.fa: Michael Madsen and Robbie Freidel -- Ground Up July 6th,2013

content.description: GREAT consistent pitch of steep but sharp climbing. The only thing this climb is missing is a long easy runout to put the cherry on top. Scramble up easy 3rd class on the lakeside of the formation near a fallen tree to a possible belay ledge and the base of the climb. Around the Corner at the fins low point Start up the fin/arete and follow the bolt line just left of the arÃªte to the top From the first moves to the last it just keeps giving thin holds. The top gets tricky. Expect small sharp holds and good smearing. (Beta) Don't get suckered in to going too far left. This route is taller than the pictures show. The bolts are right where you need them not so much where you WANT them. GET ON THIS FOR A GREAT PUMP!!

Rapa Nui, the native name of Easter Island, is a sub spire of the formation Not-Stonehenge. It is located on the lakeside of the formation just south of Molar and the ridiculous unclimbable over hang. This formation has one route on it. Don't shy away by how short this route looks from the trail. Looks are deceiving this route is a nice pitch of climbing and is longer once you are up on it. Climbs and feels a lot like Harbinger. With this route being close to the dam and lake no one should shy away.
